title: Export data from a survey
content:
After you receive responses to a survey, you can export some or all of the raw data in XLSX format.  

There is a delay of up to one day in the retrieval of your survey response data. To remove this delay, you can manually retrieve the response data. For details, see Retrieve survey responses manually.

  1. From the main menu, select Build > Survey. Service Management displays the available surveys.

  2. Click the record identifier in the ID column to display the selected record.

  3. Click on the main toolbar. The Export survey responses dialog box is displayed.

    Note  

    • By default, the following items are selected when this dialog box opens for the first time for a particular survey:

      • All questions
      • The ID, name and email of the participant (if this information is included in the survey)
      • The ID and title of the record type (if this information is included in the survey)
      • The answer submission time, survey version, and survey ID in the General survey fields section.
    • If you have previously exported data for a particular survey, your last selections are saved and are automatically displayed again.

  4. Select the items in each section that you want to include in the exported data:

    Section Description
    Questions

    Displays the questions that were included in the survey.

    You must select at least one question in order to export data.
    Participant fields

    Contains the fields that apply to the submitter.

    Note If the survey was set as anonymous, this section doesn't appear.
    Record type fields

    Contains the fields that apply to the selected record type.

    Note If no record type was specified in the survey, this section doesn't appear.
    General survey fields Contains general information about the survey.

  5. When you are finished with your selections, click Export.

    The export process begins and the button changes to . One of the following things occurs:

    • If you stay on the survey record page and the process completes, the export file is downloaded automatically.

    • If you leave the survey record page and then return to it, you must manually download the export file by clicking .

    Note  

    • If the export process takes longer than 10 seconds, the following message is displayed:

      Survey export is in progress. Until the process completes, you can navigate away from this page. When the file is ready, a download link will appear here.

    • Each time you create an export file, the previous file is overwritten. The most recent export file is retained by Service Management for 10 days and then automatically deleted.
    • In cases where information doesn't exist for a requested field (for example, if a record has been deleted), N/A will appear in the spreadsheet.

Related topics
